messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tae Kwon Do
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/8/01 2:07:59 PM Pacific Standard Time, samiot@cfl.rr.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/8/01 2:07:59 PM Pacific Standard Time, samiot@...
writes:

<< I did this when I was younger. My instructor told me that is I looked for
a
new location to beware of anyone who said you'd be a black belt in X number
of years or for X amount of money. Locally one of the big organizations
puts on presentations at the local mall. I'm amazed at the "black belts"
that can do no more than we did & we were only "blue or yellow" belts. >>


Thanks. Good advice. That was one thing we liked about the old school. The
expectations were high and the curriculum rigorous.

candice

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tae Kwon Do
messages.msgSnippet: I did this when I was younger.  My instructor told me that is I looked for a new location to beware of anyone who said you d be a black belt in X number of
messages.messageBody:
I did this when I was younger. My instructor told me that is I looked for a
new location to beware of anyone who said you'd be a black belt in X number
of years or for X amount of money. Locally one of the big organizations
puts on presentations at the local mall. I'm amazed at the "black belts"
that can do no more than we did & we were only "blue or yellow" belts.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tae Kwon Do
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/8/01 1:29:42 PM Pacific Standard Time, marbleface@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/8/01 1:29:42 PM Pacific Standard Time,
marbleface@... writes:

<< Nance (off to Tae Kwon Do)
>>

Nance,

Any recommendations on how to select a martial arts school for my 10yo
daughter? She has taken classes for a couple of years and now we're in a new
area.

candice
